alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 11:21PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Kimball, southern Banner and east central Laramie Counties through 1100 PM MDT... At 1021 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles west of Harrisburg to Albin. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albin, Harrisburg and Bushnell. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 6 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
